result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Sommers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig A Sommers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig A Sommers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to pay $30.00 per month commencing June 15, 2016 and each month thereafter until paid in full.

-Defendant is to pay $30.00 per month commencing June 15, 2016 and each month thereafter until paid in full.  
-Court orders the defendant to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  On May 16, 2016 the Court sets the Court Appointed Attorney Fees at $471.83.  Court orders the $280.00 on file be applied to the Atty Fees leaving a balance of $191.83.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig A Sommers

records.addlTxt: Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Releasing Funds - $280.00 to Clerk of Courts (Ct Appt'd Atty Fees)
Amended Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Preliminary Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

10:15 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dan Sondalle.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with a fine and costs and payment schedule and the balance of the counts will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Sondalle concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Sondalle.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$50 fine plus court costs.  Court orders defendant to pay $30 per month and is to be set up  with the Clerk of Courts office.
-Re-pay costs for Ct Appt'd Atty Fees
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Statement by Atty Sondalle regarding payment plan to commence June 15th.  Statement by the Court, has no issue with the payment plan commencing on June 15th.

Statement by Atty Sondalle - will submit the bill.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
9:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has received a petition for court appointed counsel.  Statement by defendant - can pay $50.00 per month towards the attorney fees.  Court orders the defendant to pay $70.00 per month commencing January 10th, 2016 and every month thereafter.

Court adjourned at 9:47 a.m.
Status hearing at 11-24-2015 09:15 am

9:27 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the court - has received the petition for court appointed counsel.  Court will appoint counsel and questions defendant regarding payments towards court appointed counsel.  Statement by defendant - requests to talk with the DA.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA.

Court adjourned at 9:29 a.m.
Status hearing at 10-27-2015 09:15 am

9:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - is requesting court appointed counsel.  Court sets for Status Hearing on October 27, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:40 a.m.
Status hearing at 10-20-2015 09:15 am

9:18 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation - requests bond continue.  Court orders bond to continue.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 20, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:20 a.m.
